content.description: A company that manufactures laptop batteries claims the mean battery life is 16 hours. Assuming the distribution of battery life is approximately normal, a consumer group will conduct a hypothesis test to investigate whether the battery life is less than 16 hours. The group selected a random sample of 14 of the batteries and found an average life of 15.6 hours with a standard deviation of 0.8 hour.
content.question: Which of the following is the correct test statistic for the hypothesis test?

choices.label: <math alttext="t equals the fraction with numerator 15.6 minus 16, and denominator 0.8" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>15.6</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>16</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>0.8</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="t equals the fraction with numerator 16 minus 15.6, and denominator 0.8" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>16</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>15.6</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>0.8</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="t equals the fraction with numerator 15.6 minus 16, and denominator the fraction with numerator 0.8 and denominator the square root of 13" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>15.6</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>16</mn></mrow><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>0.8</mn></mrow><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mn>13</mn></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="t equals the fraction with numerator 15.6 minus 16, and denominator the fraction with numerator 0.8 and denominator the square root of 14" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>15.6</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>16</mn></mrow><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>0.8</mn></mrow><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mn>14</mn></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="t equals the fraction with numerator 16 minus 15.6, and denominator the fraction with numerator 0.8 and denominator the square root of 14" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>16</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>15.6</mn></mrow><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>0.8</mn></mrow><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mn>14</mn></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="t equals the fraction with numerator 15.6 minus 16, and denominator the fraction with numerator 0.8 and denominator the square root of 14" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>15.6</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>16</mn></mrow><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>0.8</mn></mrow><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mn>14</mn></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

topic.text: 7.5: Carrying Out a Test for a Population Mean

skill.text: Skill 3.E: Calculate a test statistic and find a p-value, provided conditions for inference are met.
